Description: Wooden mummy-case for mummified cat in form of seated cat; head painted green, body white. Also included under this number a quantity of cat bones from within the mummy-case.
Curator's comments: Published: Art and Afterlife in Ancient Egypt (Japan 1999-2000): No 150
Exhibition history: Exhibited: 2001 26 Jun-23 Sep, Birmingham Gas Hall, Egypt Revealed
Acquisition name: Purchased from: Rev Walter L Lawson
Acquisition notes: In a report to the Trustees dated 3 October 1889, recommending purchase of the Lawson collection, Renouf noted that 'many of the objects ... were purchased by Mr Lawson at a sale of Egyptian antiquities which took place in the house of a French savant this year at Alexandria; the remainder were bought at Ahmim and Luxor.' The sources of the individual objects are not specified.
